meanings.definition: To remove the mast or masts from (a ship).
meanings.sent1: The sailors were demasting the ship to repair the mast.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the crew had to demast the ship for safety.
meanings.sent3: The demasting process turned into a race among the sailors.
meanings.sent4: Demasting the ship felt like stripping it of its power.
meanings.sent5: The loud creaking sound echoed as they demasted the ship.

meanings.definition: The act of removing the mast or masts from a ship.
meanings.sent1: The demasting of the vessel was necessary for maintenance.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the demasting of the ship was a rare sight.
meanings.sent3: The demasting event turned into a festive occasion for the crew.
meanings.sent4: The demasting of the ship left it vulnerable to the elements.
meanings.sent5: The demasting process revealed the intricate design of the mast.
